basics.name: Stephanie Aelmore
basics.label: B.S. Candidate, Computer Engineering
basics.summary: Software developer with diverse simulation-focused experience and an interest in novel computing technology and interactive media. Expected graduation date: May 14th, 2022.

education.institution: University of Hawaii at Manoa, Honolulu, HI

work.summary: Teaching Assistant for Basic Circuit Analysis II
highlights: Led 2 sections of Basic Circuit Analysis II laboratory, supervising and tutoring 38 students
Graded lab reports, assisted students with circuit troubleshooting, performed part inventories and requisitions

work.summary: Assistant researcher for DoD basic research projects
highlights: Conducted self-directed research at a graduate level, culminating in a publication and invention disclosure
Evaluated, developed, and implemented event-based computer vision algorithms (Arc*, SOFAS) in Python
Designed, performed, and analyzed experiments functionalizing semiconductor quantum dots and ionogels
Utilized MATLAB to collect and analyze data and provided routine technical reports to project PI

work.summary: Served as technical consultant and operator on reactor instrumentation and control systems
highlights: 12+ months as Lead Supervisor and Technical Consultant on reactor instrumentation and control systems, provided direct mentorship 10 people resulting in team members receiving four promotions and three performance-based awards
Led department-wide classroom training on reactor theory and instrumentation, resulting in the department achieving top scores three years in a row on operational examinations

volunteer.position: Lead Software Engineer for Instrumentation and Control Subsystem
volunteer.summary: VIP Team RoSE will design and build a rover to compete in the June 2022 University Rover Competition
highlights: Designed software architecture, selected hardware and software components, and programmed UART serial communications for onboard computing on mock mars rover for the University Rover Competition
Created development and test plan using publisher-subscriber pattern and continuous integration

volunteer.summary: Applied for and received funding, handled dues and reimbursements with zero incidents

awards.title: Navy and Marine Corps Achievement Medal
awards.summary: Awarded four times for outstanding technical skills and leadership ability.

awards.title: Dean's List
awards.awarder: University of Hawaii College of Engineering
awards.summary: Awarded five times for maintaining semster GPA greater than 3.5.
